website_summaries.verdict: With an ergonomic and easy to clean design, this cutter has a lot to love. The grip works great for right or left handed users.
pros: Rubber handle gives some and contours to your hand creating maximum comfort
Entire product is dishwasher safe and cleans up easily
Blue, red, green, or purple color options
cons: A few users have had problems with the handle, and in a few cases users felt like the handle was larger for their hands

customer_reviews.title: I'm tired of buying garbage. I have reached a point in my life ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm tired of buying garbage. I have reached a point in my life where I refuse to buy throwaway products which is mostly what Walmart stocks on their shelves. I did a little research as my wife's 3rd pastry blender had broken and came across this one. The handle is truly a rubber handle which makes it easy to hold. The steel is all continuous and all intersections have been welded not stamped (stamped = garbage). It arrived well packaged and I'm happy so far. I will update if anything develops but thus far as a professional woodworker who appreciates quality I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to someone.
customer_reviews.author: Roger E. Funk III

customer_reviews.title: This one sounded fantastic, but alas
customer_reviews.text: I had such high hopes for this pastry blender. I have somewhat weak hands,and my old pastry blender would hurt my hands. This one sounded fantastic, but alas, it works about as well as my old standard pastry blender. I prefer to make pastry by hand, and not use the food processor (too many parts to clean). This one promised that the dough would not stick (but it did) and that it would be easier to use than a traditional pastry blender (but it wasn't). I'm sorry to leave such a negative review, but this pie blender is really no different than any other one.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this pastry cutter for a little while now, and have used it about six times. I love this design! It works better than the old standard design, and the blades don’t bend. I make my family biscuits at least once a week, and this is such a great tool to use. I was leery of going against the normal design, but after having to replace three cutters due to bent and broken blades after weekly use, I was ready to try something new. I’m sold. ❤️
customer_reviews.author: Jodi H. W.

customer_reviews.title: Love this Item !!!
customer_reviews.text: I saw this pastry cutter while watching something on youtube and thought wow that looks so different for my very old one and seemed to work a lot better too for what I saw. So off I went to Amazon and bingo there it was so I ordered it. Arrived in a timely manner considering our rotating postal strike. Just love how sharp the cutting blades are and goes through butter or shortening so fast. Love the ergonomic handle and makes so much sense with the way it works and feels in your hands. A great item and would recommend. So happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Janet B.

customer_reviews.title: Loving this product so far
customer_reviews.text: Have had this pastry cutter for only a month or so. And, have only made a couple of pies with it so far. But, so far, it looks like the pastry cutter I have been looking for! The wire ones are useless. The sheet metal ones are better, but one still needs to soften the butter at least a bit, or they will bend. And, the handle screws will back out. Seem to have solved all these issues for myself with this purchase. Current rating is a cautiously optimistic 4-stars. It has been rock solid so far. Will upgrade to 5-stars if it continues to pan out after further use.
customer_reviews.author: Gud Spellur

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitchen Helper!
customer_reviews.text: I much prefer to make my own pastry and this tool has cut the blending time in half compared to others I have used. Paid less for them, but they did much less. Excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: I love it because my wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: I love it because my wife loves it. She had this as one of her xmas want items. She uses it primarily to cut butter into her biscuit dough. Works well if you ask be cause them biscuits are delicious.
customer_reviews.author: RevJVegas

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but an improvement!
customer_reviews.text: While this is a huge improvement over my old wire pastry cutter, I do wish the blades on this were a little sharper. It does feel sturdy, no bend it in at all. I recently made several butter pie crusts with this pastry cutter, and it works fine. Not perfect, but an improvement!
customer_reviews.author: Roget

customer_reviews.title: Best pastry blender
customer_reviews.text: This pastry blender is the best I have used. I own one and bought one for my daughter-in-law. The usual pastry blender design bends and breaks after a few uses and does not hold up to heavy duty work. This pastry blender is sturdy and has held up great. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara S.

customer_reviews.title: You can't get a better Pie/pastry blender, I also use it to mash potatoes.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice design, the other one I have has flat blades, and it has to be soaked to get it clean, This one cleans very easily, and it is very well built with a nice handle.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M.

customer_reviews.title: This is a game changer. I've destroyed many a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a game changer. I've destroyed many a pie blender and this one kicks the butt of all others! Work is faster though do be careful not to overblend!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Stone

customer_reviews.title: Best pastry cutter design.
customer_reviews.text: Love this but it is getting bent after a year of use.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: I like my OXO better.
customer_reviews.text: I found this awkward to use, as it felt too tall to me. I like my OXO better, as it is stout with curved blades that match the shape of the sides of the bowl, unlike this one which is flat on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Momto2boys

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little getting use to but is quicker than my old cutter. Does a better job of cutting butter. It will also slice butter.
customer_reviews.author: A. E. McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Great pastery cutter
customer_reviews.text: Works better then the 1/2 round style. I like both styles but this is much better. The handle is longer which makes it easier to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Design
customer_reviews.text: I've tossed two previously owned pastry blenders because they either caused hand or wrist pain. This one from kitchen innovations does the job beautifully, without causing discomfort. It is also very easy to clean. Great design.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl in Birmingham

customer_reviews.title: Last Pastry Blender you will ever buy.
customer_reviews.text: I've destroyed many pastry blenders over my lifetime. This one is so sturdy and well designed yhat it is on track to be the last one I purchase. I found mine locally and ordered this one for my mother. My best friend also swears by it.
customer_reviews.author: NatasKnots

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Love this for mixing doughs as well as smashing soft fruits and berries. Works well for blending pastry dough for lemon bars. I also use it when making blueberry muffins, to smash half the berries before folding them into the batter. Nice that I can put it in the dishwasher as well.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: worthless
customer_reviews.text: Does not perform as described. Must use a knife to remove butter or shortening after each stroke of ingredients. Sorry I fell for the hype.
customer_reviews.author: jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Cuts and blends with easy effort.
customer_reviews.text: Works great better than any others I have owned .
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.text: Easily mashes potatoes and blends in the butter and spices
customer_reviews.author: Karla

customer_reviews.title: Great pastry blender
customer_reviews.text: Best pastry blender I’ve ever had. Easy to hold and nice sturdy prongs. Toss it on the upper rack if the dishwasher to clean.
customer_reviews.author: JAS

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: this is a great pastry blender. I had a different metal one that constantly got bent . this one stay perfect!
customer_reviews.author: V. & J. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Love this pastry blender.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has one that I tried and then couldn’t wait to get one of my own! It’s so much easier to use for making pies and biscuits than the old one I’ve been using. Since I’ve gotten older and don’t have the strength in my hands and wrists that I used to, this pastry blender is much more ergonomic and easier to use. I can’t speak to durability since I’ve had it such a short time, but it seems very well made and I look forward to using it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Ginagold13

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen innovations Pie blender
customer_reviews.text: The best pastry blender I have had. It is durable and the hand grip keeps your hand from slipping so you have a firm grip when blending ice cold shortening & flour. Others I have purchased either bend or the welds giveaway. This is my 2nd one I have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Lolly

customer_reviews.title: Saved my aching hands
customer_reviews.text: I am a pie baker. I bake about 16 hours per week. I love this item because my hands no longer ache as bad as they did before. Use a bigger bowl though so you can maneuver it easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is the very best Pie Blender. Works great for cutting butter into other things also.
customer_reviews.author: Slick

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This pastry cutter is easy to use and clean. The height keeps the dough away from my hand so it doesn’t warm up from my body heat. Very nice and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: DRL

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great for making my piecrust... really good job mixing the Dough....Love it

customer_reviews.title: Great for making egg salad!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to smash eggs for egg salad and it works great. Also is easy to clean quickly.

customer_reviews.title: This is the best I've ever owned!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST pastry cutter I've ever owned. It's ergonomic, it's made of metal which gives it a nice weight and it cuts like crazy!! The flat bottom makes it stable as you're cutting.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mosley

customer_reviews.title: does not work in small bowls
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst pastry blender I've ever used. It does not allow for any rocking motion along the sides of a bowl when making pie crust. The butter just clogs up onto the cross pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I didn’t really care for it after I used it
customer_reviews.text: I wish it were wider n my hands still got messy I had to just continue kneading with my hand

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy cutter
customer_reviews.text: Best pastry cutter I’ve ever used. I’ve only made 5 batches of dough with it but it is by far the best built pastry cutter I’ve ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Carlson

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Best pastry knife ever! Even unicorns use this one when they make fluffy rainbows!
customer_reviews.author: Sheepdiver

customer_reviews.title: I used cold butter, and the butter stuck to ...
customer_reviews.text: I used cold butter, and the butter stuck to the prongs of this pastry blender, and it was a pain to unstick the butter. I ended up using my hands to blend the butter and shortening. This gadget is a pain in the neck. I have baked 2-3 pies a week (at least) for the last 40 years. In my experience, it's much easier to use your hands to blend the butter and shortening, or a traditional pastry blender/cutter.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sweat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pie Blender
customer_reviews.text: Very best for pie blending, the name says it all.
customer_reviews.author: Goshen

customer_reviews.title: Appears well made and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Appears well made and sturdy. I haven't actually used it yet
customer_reviews.author: L. E. L.

customer_reviews.title: It cuts butter like buttu, smooth
customer_reviews.text: It cuts butter like buttu, smooth. What I noticed first thing is it is flat, what if I make my dough in a bowl? On the front page you don't give the scale, is left perfect or is far right perfect. That's why I chose middle.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Noble

customer_reviews.title: Love this Pie Blender
customer_reviews.text: Finally a pie blender which works. Been making pie crusts for 50 years and can't remember the number of pie blenders I have purchased each time thinking maybe this time they will work. Each time I was disappointed and returned to mixing pie dough with forks and my hands. This blender is amazing. In addition to easily incorporating the butter or shortening into the flour for a wonderfully flaky crust, the blender also does a great job cutting cold butter into manageable pieces without making a mess. I am so happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Hurricane

customer_reviews.title: Good, but design needs tweaking.
customer_reviews.text: This has so much going for it - sturdy, dishwasher safe, comfortable handle, cuts through butter really well. But, and it's a big but, it doesn't work well in a bowl with a rounded bottom. Since this cutter is completely flat on the bottom, I found it difficult to maneuver in the largest of my mixing bowls and it tended to want to scatter pastry mixture out of the bowl. If one were cutting in butter on a flat surface, it would be perfect, but I'm not blessed with such a set-up. If this were curved on the bottom somewhat more like a traditional pastry cutter, it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Born in the USA

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this -- it is BETTER than OXO Good Grips!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best pastry blender available! I have tried several, including OXO Good Grips, but this is better. The grip is surer, and my hand didn't cramp when I was working very cold butter into flour. The tines are very sturdy and are slightly triangular, so they cut right through butter that is REALLY cold. I used to use my food processor for pie pastry, but with this dishwasher safe pastry blender, my pie pastry and cleanup are done faster than when I used electricity to cut in the fat.
customer_reviews.author: Lacemaker427

customer_reviews.title: ... our family pies but the last few years always hated getting the pie dough ready
customer_reviews.text: My 58 year old husband for years made our family pies but the last few years always hated getting the pie dough ready. He has arthritis which made using the traditional pie blender with the wires hurt his hands blending the ingredients. This design with wider and more comfortable handle and this is constructed more sturdy and easier to blend everything together. I guess that means more cherry and apple pies for our family this year! Yea.... Great Product and would highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: B Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Like tryin to fit a square peg into a round hole....
customer_reviews.text: We all know the adage, so why do the manufacturers think producing a flat, square utensil will work in a largely rounded bottom bowl, which most us use to prepare for our baked goods? It really is next to impossible to efficiently cut anything into your flour or whatever, always leaving large gaps where your shortening is left uncut. Additionally, the triangular blades do nothing to keep the shortening from clogging up the blades and actually makes the cutting more difficult due to the added resistance created by the thicker blades. On the upside, it is very well made and probably will last a frustrating lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Natural Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Throw away your weak pastry cutter.
customer_reviews.text: This one is by far superior to any other cutter I've tried. Solid!!! The handle is solid as well as the blades. No chinsey, weak blades that bend or pull out. This is the last one I will need to purchase because it's made to last. Much more comfortable to hold and use and my hand doesn't cramp. Cut through frozen butter with very little effort. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pie or cobbler tonight!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! So comfortable and sturdy to use! I saw someone using one like this making a pie on Utube and started looking for one immediately. Very handy for blending any dry ingredients and especially like it for making pie crusts.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Christofferson

customer_reviews.title: bought for work
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up for work, so i could mix the butter and sugar better, it not only works great for that, but at times i have to cut up some noodles for a kid who has problems eating works great for that as well, use for 100+ things at work, everyone loves it.
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: Durable, quick clean up, time saver!
customer_reviews.text: I watched a video of a pastry chef using a similar tool & I wanted one & found this one. I love the durability, ease of use & I use this tool for pastry, pie dough biscuits, to cut cold butter into thin slices, etc. It's best used on a flat surface & works so quickly, I save lots of time! Great tool for bakers!
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy blender
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time yesterday. It worked very well but think it could be improved by having a curve at the sides. Sturdier that my previous pie blender.
customer_reviews.author: marymary

customer_reviews.title: A cut above the rest
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 of these! I make my own pie crust and my recipe is my grandmothers. I make all the pies for all my friends and family. I love this Pastry fork or as my son and husband call it, my butter cutter. This is sturdy and I’ve had my first one for years. While mine was missing, I got a standard D shaped fork and broke it before I was done with my first batch of crust. I won’t make that mistake again.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Moreau

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the flimsy thing I tolerated for years. It holds its own and doesn't separate as it pushes through soon-to-be pie dough.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Well made and well thought out design.
customer_reviews.text: Strong in design and manufacture, a welcome addition to my pantry. This implement replaces a forty year old tool that has served me well and I consider this to be an improvement. I have high expectations for its longevity.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great item. Very strong
customer_reviews.text: Great item. Very strong, durable and well made. Easy to use and make life easier for making pie dough crust. I would highly recommend this item. I tried others and in my opinion, this item is the "Best" hands down. You will not be disappointed. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Haleck

customer_reviews.title: Taller than regular U shaped cutters.
customer_reviews.text: Much better than my U shaped cutter... looking forward to mashing potatoes, too! Update... mashes wonderfully!

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Pastry Cutter
customer_reviews.text: We've used this for several years, bought two for Christmas presents for kids. Well made. Hard to make an ergonomic claim, but since it blends the crust faster, it must be better ergonomically.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Best pie blender I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best pie blender I've ever owned. It makes easy work of blending pie or biscuit dough, with perfect results. I used it to break up apples as they were cooking for applesauce. Highly recommend.

customer_reviews.text: This pastry cutter is the best product ever. It cuts the lard into the flour with ease. The cutter is very easy to use and works well.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is the sturdiest, most efficient pastry blender I have ever used. Absolutely awesome!

customer_reviews.text: This is the best hand pastry blender I have ever used. It is ergonomically the most comfortable and it does a far better job of blending the ingredients than the wire or blade kind.

Maybe a little sturdier than average, but not much. And, as someone noted, it is not round, so it doesn't work all that well with round bowls.

product_meta.title: Kitchen Innovations KI-100102 FBA_KI-100102 Perfect Pie Blender, Pastry Cutter-Best in Class-Stainless Steel Blades with Ergonomic Handle-Red, Small,

Versatile; this blender is perfect for pies, scones, streusel, mashing bananas, blueberries and other fruits, chicken pot pies, meat pies and more
